boardgame.name: Pizza KATA
boardgame.description:
Pizza KATA (where KATA stands for “KAnban TakeAway) is a serious game where you can combine a fast paced real time card game with all metrics normally adopted in kanban such as a visualise the flow, time measure, tickets, timers,…

Each pack can be used by a single team of 3 to 6 players, with roles and challenging activities. You can easily use the material of the game to scale to many teams in competitive or collaborative mode, so you can create workshops up to 30 people with a single facilitator (with more facilitators the game can further scale).

The game is articulated in different “days” where every team try to improve their performance and increase performance and predictability of the activities. In fact the term “kata” (Japanese word for “model”) is also adopted in martial arts with the philosophy of practice to perfection.

In the pack you can find also material to track and measure activities, so in the retrospective (between two days) you have numbers to understand the impact of the decision taken by the team.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Pizza Box Sports (On The Line Game Company)

boardgame.name: Sword Worlds
boardgame.description:
From the publisher website:

This book examines how the worlds of the Confederation interact with one another, and how a technologically outmatched people have managed to stave off Imperial dominance for so long. Their armed forces are technologically simple yet incredibly resilient; their navy is very different to that of the Imperium. Minelayers, torpedo boats and orbital defence platforms defend the home worlds whilst battlecruisers raid deep into enemy territory.

boardgame.name: The Goonies: Under the Goondocks – A Never Say Die Expansion
boardgame.description:
Troy and his father's plan to turn the Goondocks into a country club have failed. With the help of Stef, Andy, and Brand, you must stop Troy from finding One-Eyed-Willie's treasure before it's too late!

This expansion is the continuation of The Goonies: Never Say Die story filled with new foes, treasures, and characters over three exciting adventures!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shadows of Sindal
boardgame.description:
From the publisher website:

Shadows of Sindal is a three-part campaign set against the backdrop of the Pirates of Drinax. The discovery of a long-forgotten key prompts a mission to Paal, an easy task to find and open a vault containing treasures from the Empire of Sindal. King Oleb expects a quick return with a huge payoff, but nothing is ever that simple.

In Search of Sindal: The Travellers voyage to Paal and search for the vault. They discover that someone has used a horrific bioweapon against Aslan settlers in the world’s remote outback. Rather than killing them it has turned the warlike but noble Aslan into deranged murderers. The vault does indeed contain treasure, but not the sort King Oleb is expecting.

The Plague of Sindal: Reports that the bioweapon has been used on other bands of Aslan suggest someone is testing it before attacking a major world. Tensions are rising; it seems likely the Aslan Hierate will strike to pre-empt the threat, and the border worlds will suffer the consequences. The Travellers are set the task of finding out who is developing this weapon and shutting them down to prevent a war.

The Prince of Sindal: Prince Richter of Gerhai has proclaimed himself heir to the Sindalian Empire. His followers are forming militias on worlds all along the Dustbelt and there is open conflict on Acis. If Richter wins, King Oleb’s dreams of reclaiming the Sindalian Empire are dead. If the Aslan win, Drinax is doomed. The Travellers must find a way to derail Richter’s scheme without causing a war with the Aslan – or handing control of the Dustbelt to the Hierate.

Shadows of Sindal can be played as part of the Pirates of Drinax campaign or as a standalone adventure.

boardgame.name: Wasters
boardgame.description:
The role-playing game of dystopian survival, raiders, corporations and cybertech

From the introduction:

Amidst the cyberpunk dystopia life is beset by controlling authorities, ruthless corporations, organised crime and street gangs. There are few easy ways to get rich quick. Anyone with enough riches to be considered well-off will find themselves the target of greedy thieves, jealous thugs and overbearing gangs demanding protection money – not to mention the authorities that will suddenly take an interest if you have something they can squeeze you for. Just trying to survive day to day is the priority for many, and opportunities for really building a life and making a difference are limited to those already in power.

Many become part of the oppressive systems in the slums and become one of the abusers and exploiters out of desperation. As a bureaucrat or law enforcer, corporate lackey, gang thug or some sort of underworld operative taking shady night-time freelancing. In the slums you have a reasonable expectation of not being shot unless you provoke someone, enter gang turf without permission, bother the police, or lack the wits to get out of the way when a raiders go on a rampage.

Outside the slums are the wastes – abandoned by any form of order or protection from economic collapse, disaster or war and with untold wealth abandoned in the shattered ruins. You were once part of the slums but through misfortune, carelessness, or disillusionment you have left that behind. Now you seek to trawl through ruins and wastes for long lost valuables, risk impossible odds to get rich quick, tread into nuclear fallout or biohazard zones, take on the most ridiculous mission just for that one big shot.

You venture into the wastes, the parts of the city abandoned by the authorities, corporations, and organised crime. When you venture into the wastes you are surrounded by rampant gangs, wild animals and malfunctioning bots as you search collapsed corporate complexes, buried nuclear bunkers and forgotten headquarters from a flavour-of-the-month gang that fell apart and was never heard from since.

Those in the slums call you Wasters. But not to your face, because they’re scared of you.

boardgame.name: Haven (Isn't too far Away)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The panicked townsfolk of Caer-Konig prepare to abandon their homes, but food is scarce! Gathering for the exodus is difficult! Frightened hunters return empty-handed, driven away from bountiful hunting ground by spine-chilling, chanting specters! Can heroes replenish the townsfolk before their departure AND before the arrival of The Destructive Light?

Take your Tier One adventurers on the search for the Hunter's Bounty and help the those in need on their way to safe haven. This adventure takes place during events in Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden, by Wizards of the Coast. Any mention of any themes, creatures or personalities from this book is purely intentional. It is my unique interpretation of the Chwinga, Chwinga, CHWINGA! Adventure Seed!
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Zombies at the Zalkens
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The smothering fog hangs thick in the air around you, muffling all sounds of wildlife and plunging you into an eerie silence. Suddenly, a low guttural moan drifts towards you, followed by another and another. You can make out several shadowy humanoid figures approaching you. Their eyes burn a dark crimson red...the color of blood.
...
This adventure is designed for four to six 3rd level characters and should take about 6 hours to finish, depending on the group.

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Guide to Varamont
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore Varamont, a brand new domain of dread complete with Dark Lord, setting, and adventure ideas. Varamont is a domain of monsters and warfare, inspired by stories like Game of Thrones, Castlevania, and the Witcher.

Contend with warring lords, fight monsters scouring the countryside, and battle against the mysterious and violent lich, the Dead Lord!

boardgame.name: Shipwrecked! Part 4 - Mystery of Fang Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Merchant sailors whisper of an abandoned trading post in the infamous Serpent Island chain of the Islands of the Utter South. Not willing to allow this mystery to stand, you and your sidekick Aliz’ah seek to solve the Mystery of Fang Island!

boardgame.name: The Sky Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

High up in the Crag Mountains, there is an ancient burial chamber called The Sky Tomb. There is talk that unimaginable treasures are available for those who dare. It is also said that the road there is difficult and that the burial chamber is guarded by dangerous monsters.

Included with the adventure is several high resolution, beautiful and detailed maps.

boardgame.name: Cult of the Pit God!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the desert wastes of Tamoa sits the city of Xionen, the Ivory Jewel. This city of thieves and miscreants is ruled by the immortal sorcerer kings, while corrupt politians and merchant princes fight for whatever crumbs of power remain, turning to horrible rituals and dark magics to achieve their goals.

Approached by the daughter of the powerful merchant prince Sathul, the party are charged with stealing the mystic emerald of Lok'tharr during a hedonistic party of debauchery at her father's mansion palace. But the players are in for more than they bargain for when they learn they are the honoured guests of the cult of the pit god!

This one-shot adventure is created as a sword and sorcery caper, where magic is distrusted, the protagonists are morally grey, and life is brutal, bloody, and short. Players will need to trust in their natural strength and guile in equal parts to survive this pulp action thriller!


WARNING This adventure contains mature themes and should be adjusted appropriately for the group and players tastes and expectations.

boardgame.name: The Copperline Bank & Loan: A Bank Heist Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Test Your Skills as a Master Thief! The Copperline Bank & Loan is a short adventure for 4-6 players levels 2-5, and features everything your party needs to prove they are master criminals, from the hour-to-hour schedules of the bank executives to the NPC’s who can help bypass the bank’s security. Does your crew want to run through the front door with their weapons drawn? Or do they want to take a more subtle approach and carefully plot out every detail of the caper?

This book includes eleven new locks you can use in any campaign, the Cat Burglar feat, the safecracker’s tools, and full color maps of the bank. This adventure includes three adventure hooks so that even law-abiding citizens are welcome to test their skills.

Want to make things more exciting? Try one of the Complications included in this adventure to see just how well your party handles surprises during their heist.

If all goes according to plan, your party might just make it out of the bank with arms full of treasure. There’s only one way to find out. Are you up to the challenge?

boardgame.name: The Abandoned Village of Presov
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

THE ABANDONED VILLAGE OF PRESOV is a location supplement for Tier 2 gaming groups exploring the Misty Lands of Barovia.

Grab your party and venture into the slopes of Mount Baratok, explore the haunted ruins of a great Barovian village, and uncover mysteries that can turn Strahd's land against him!

This supplement can be used within Curse of Strahd and the additions made in the new release Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft.

boardgame.name: Follies of Summoning
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

QUEST TO STOP THE HIDDEN MENACE AND SAVE A VILLAGE FROM INFERNAL DAMNATION!

Presenting Follies of Summoning, a one to two session adventure, scaled for characters of 1st, 5th, and 10th levels and easily adaptable to other levels. Suitable for stand-alone play or insertion in to an existing campaign of nearly any setting!

Follies of Summoning is an action-packed adventure with new settings, maps, characters, and hulking undead monstrosities with unique combat abilities. Players can dive into the story and determine who is to blame for causing the disappearances of local villagers, or forego all the talking and just start slashing their way to the heart of the matter! Tailor Follies of Summoning to fit YOUR play style by utilizing the provided encounter tables, motivated NPCs, and detailed settings.

A new small tavern, The Resting Pig, is provided to serve as the starting point of the adventure. Use the tavern and its map, detailed room layout, and fully developed NPC staff for this or any other adventures at your leisure!

boardgame.name: Bloody Mad
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sleepy little town of Scharokhova has gone from dreary to depressing and dangerous. Shortly after a strange man in a hooded cloak came to town one evening, visiting the posh manor home of the local noble family, the Petrovas, a fog descended upon the valley where the town lies.

What’s more, all manners of beasts, from rats to bats to wolves, are attacking the townsfolk, or destroying their supplies. And that fog! Anyone that tries to leave escape the town through the fog finds their mind too addled to make it through. And those that made it the furthest were set upon by beasts, beasts that seemed to try to keep the villagers from leaving town.

Now, the townsfolk’s only hope rests with a group of outsiders who made it to the village through the mist, and now find themselves stuck in town, just like the residents have been.

Eliminate the beasts threatening the townsfolk!

boardgame.name: Marvel United: X-Men – First Class
boardgame.description:
X-Men: First Class is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that brings the first appearance of the X-Men to life! Go back to the first days of Xavier’s School for Gifted Youngsters and play with the original incarnation of these iconic Heroes and Villains. These characters not only have game pieces that reflect their classic looks, but also their game mechanics reflect a less experienced and more “raw” version of them. The Maximoff twins, Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver, form a unique villainous duo, working together to bring down the Heroes. And finally, the set of Locations contained in this expansion also bring the Danger Room, a special Location attachment that gives Heroes access to special Training!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 16
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What's Inside This Week's Issue?
The Ankylodon - A CR 9 hulking beast of burden with a rolling defensive attack

New Harvesting Materials - Spine fragments, vertebrae, hide and bones

6 New Magical Items To Craft - Ankylixer Brew, Ankylo Armor, Ankylodagger, Bone Pike, Shield, and Javelin of the Beast

5 Plot Hooks - Various bounties, rumors and suggestions for introducing the Ankylodon to your home games

For The Love of Ankylodons! - A short one shot adventure for 4 - 6 players of 8th level, ready to run out of the box, complete with monster tokens and full color map, NPC details and rewards

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!

boardgame.name: Marvel United: X-Men – The Horsemen of Apocalypse
boardgame.description:
The Horsemen of the Apocalypse is an epic Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that pits the X-Men against the might of the first mutant: Apocalypse. And to make matters worse, Apocalypse is not alone, as he has gathered his four lieutenants around him to help carry out his apocalyptic plan. In ride the four horsemen: Famine, War, Pestilence, and Death.

Players can choose to face Apocalypse directly, in a daunting game where the Four Horsemen are his Threats, but with their character pieces present on the play area and moving around the Locations to sow destruction. If they want the ultimate challenge, however, players can use the Four Horsemen Mode, where the battle against Apocalypse is preceded by a game against just the Four Horsemen. They will have to face each Horseman, one by one, each with a reduced Master Plan deck and their own set of rules and challenges. By being victorious, players will be able to take extra Action tokens to the final battle against Apocalypse. However, each Horseman that succeeds will be a more powerful Threat in the final game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fire and Brimstone
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Fire and Brimstone is a platform game with a theme from religion. You play as Thor on the way to Niflheim to find and kill Hel.

boardgame.name: Kumakiti family no saiko no teatime
くまきちファミリーの最高のティータイム (Kmakici Family's Greatest Teatime)
boardgame.description:
くまきちファミリーの最高のティータイム (Kumakiti family no saiko no teatime) (Kmakici Family's Greatest Teatime) is a card game from Japan featuring a family of soft toys lead by a bear, Kmakici. It includes a dolphin, a squid and a rock band of rabbits. The family are created by an artist Raityo Tsume (雷鳥つめ) and are popular in Japan in SNS messaging apps.

The various characters in the Kmakici family are on the cards in different combinations. Players draw and play cards to the table from a hand of three, trying to build sets of five different characters. If a player places a card which completes a set of five, they draw a token from the end of a line.

The tokens show a grilled steak initially, but on the hidden side are sweets, cakes and teatime treats. Players are trying to get four different treats to win the game outright.

However, if a player cannot or will not play a card, they draw a steak, which, being unsuitable for a tea party, counts as negative points. If all the tokens are claimed without a direct winner, then the player with fewest steaks wins.

Whilst the game is aimed squarely at young children, a Japanese reviewer found the game to be more complex and challenging than expected.

The publisher says:
Let's start a great teatime with our friends.

In this game, you have to collect five different characters on the field. When it is your turn to play, you draw a card from the deck and put up to three cards from your hand on the field. However, only one card of the same type of character can be played on the field.

If you manage to get the fifth character on the field, you get the candy on the back of the chip.

The chips are laid out in a straight line, steak side first, and are taken in the order in which they are laid out during the game.

If you don't have any cards to play or don't want to play, you will have to take the steak (negative points).

If a player is able to collect four different sweets, that player wins at that moment, and if all the chips are gone, the player with the least steak wins.

友と、最高のティータイムを始めよう。
　このゲームは、5種類のキャラクターを場に集めるゲームです。
　プレイヤーは自分の手番が来たら、山札から1枚カードを引いて、手札からカードを3枚までで場に出していきます。ですが、場には同じ種類のキャラクターは１枚しか出せません。
　みごと5種類目のキャラクターを場に出した人は、チップの裏面のお菓子を手に入れることができます。
　チップは最初にステーキの面を向けて一本道に並べてゲーム中は並べた順番に取っていきます。
　出せるカードがない、または出したくない時にはステーキ（マイナス点）を取ることになってしまいます。
　お菓子を4種類集めることが出来たら、その瞬間にそのプレイヤーの勝ち、チップがすべてなくなった場合はステーキの少ない人の勝ちです。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Monsters 5: Demons
boardgame.description:
The Face Of Evil

Demons are the ideal monsters. They can show up anywhere with no more justification than "they were summoned," they can survive indefinitely in a dungeon without much explanation, and killing them poses no serious moral dilemma for anyone. As a bonus, they give demon-slayers, demonologists, and holy warriors a boost in importance – if you include those niches in your campaign, you have to include lots of demons!

Demons embody not just Evil, but also Chaos; they come in an infinity of forms. GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 5: Demons provides a systematic guide to types of demons and their attributes, attacks, defenses, and special powers, allowing you to create (and in many cases, randomly roll) a demon to order. While it isn't a "bestiary," it concludes with six worked examples to get you started, plus a guide to where to find all the other demons in Dungeon Fantasy and Pyramid, Volume 3.

Get ready to get summoning!

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: Snow in the Desert
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 553rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a snow blanket covering the desert's sands as well as the sparse vegetation and rocks large or small.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Canyon Crossroads
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 554th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features some intersecting mountain paths.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Murder & Mutiny Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Murder & Mutiny contains true tales of shipwrecks, mutineers, and mayhem on the high seas! This volume is filled with information that can be mined for worldbuilding details usable in your own settings. There are colorful characters that can be adapted as villains and non-player characters. Story hooks abound, either as background details for your game world, or as adventure seeds for player characters to pursue.

In presenting the Pirate Reference series, my goal is to get people to look beyond official gaming material for inspiration. There is a wealth of ideas to be found in history, biographies, and older fiction from before the tabletop roleplaying game era that is waiting to be tapped. My hope is that this book with fire up your imagination, and help you to discover new possibilities.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ancient Tree - RPG Encounter Map Pack

Deep in the darkest part of the forest lay the remains of an ancient Titan Tree, now just a gigantic rotting hollow stump.

Rumours tell of the twisted creatures of vine and branch that grow from the corpse of this elder tree and any venturing close should be wary of the tangling roots that seem to shift and move beneath the shallow earth.

Includes both a hollow and sealed version, where you can use the hollow version for a reveal of the inside as characters venture in to the giant tree stump.

This battle map is 25x50.

This stone bridge is ancient and is either a natural span of rock or was made via deep magic in ages past.

In this age it's an important crossing point for this deep ravine and a frequent site for an ambush given how exposed anyone crossing becomes.

boardgame.name: Tropical Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Palm trees and tropical groundcover sway in the ocean breeze on this small, sandy island that’s nestled behind a colorful reef. Waves lap against rocky ledges, spitting white foam over sandy and stone.
Blue and red coral grow on rocky shelves beneath the waves, while fish dart out between green anemones and seaweed.

boardgame.name: Tagami's Webwoods
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small village, nestled within a dark forest and fortified with a wall of sharpened timber. Darkness shrouds the area, and spiderwebs hang like tangled nets between trees. Dirt paths wind their way throughout the village and surrounding trees, while a wooden bridge crosses a small, murky pond.
Lamps line the walkways, and many storage barrels and crates can be found within the village itself. Some of the roofs for the huts are tiled, while others have been thatched with straw.

boardgame.name: The Siege of Windhall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"From afar, you see smoke trailing from what seems to be the location of Windhall. As you get closer, the smoke is more noticeable and you hear the sound of clashing metal. Worried, you hurry over the last hill, and to your horror the town of Windhall is being attacked! Small catapults are flinging burning bundles into the town, and the town guard is fighting a desperate battle against a legion of orks!"

Save the town of Windhall from destruction in the second Quest Book from the "HERO TIME" setting!

boardgame.name: The Hourglass Ruby Case
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Maxwell Manor, outside the town of Celstone, a small yet very expensive gem known as the "Hourglass Ruby" has been stolen. Now it's up to the heroes to find the clues, question the suspects, and solve The Hourglass Ruby Case!

Solve a gem theft and arrest the thief in the third Quest Book from the "HERO TIME" setting!

boardgame.name: Rules Supplement: The Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Partake in gladiator matches and player-versus-player combat in the world of Hero Time! This rules supplement will tell you how to run gladiator games, from match set-ups and giving rewards, and includes an arena to fight in with additional terrain you can add to spice up the matches! Additionally you will find rules and suggestions so that Player Characters can fight each other in matches both friendly and lethal.

Within you will find 12 different types of gladiators you can fight with or against, who use 12 new items that can be added to your current setting! However, you will need somewhere appropriate to fight with them, so there is an arena map that can be customized with a page of 10 different types of tiles that can be cut out and added to it at your leisure.

But that's not all! These rules are put into play with a bonus one-shot adventure, "The Kharnsday Brawl", where the heroes take part in an famous annual gladiator match for a chance at glory!

boardgame.name: Marvel United: X-Men – Gold Team
boardgame.description:
The X-Men: Gold Team expansion brings another iconic X-Men team, featuring classic Heroes that will each bring their own twist to the game. It also features a Villain that will bring the full power of the Hellfire Club to bear against the X-Men. That is, if the X-Men can stop fighting against each other long enough to take care of this menace, as this expansion also contains all the contents and rules necessary to play the Team vs Team Mode.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hungry for Humans
boardgame.description:
In Hungry for Humans, you have a monster friend who really, really wants to eat you. But if you feed it the best human food we have to offer, you will curb its human hunger and help it become the most powerful monster in the wild. Luckily, you’ve discovered the scenic hills of West Virginia - the one place in the world where the food is delicious enough, the people are friendly enough, and the landscape is majestic enough to take the edge off any monster’s human hunger. Here, your monster will take part in a weekend of feasting on the world’s best cuisine. But be careful, your fellow humans may try to sabotage your monster’s next meal and leave you to become a human corn dog.

Each round the humans will submit dishes to a meal that the hungriest monster will eat. The hungriest monster is decided by the Hunger Level tiles which the humans will secretly choose for their monster before each meal is revealed. The meal will be revealed and the humans will then play Monster Power cards to sabotage other monsters or help their own. The Hunger Level tiles will then be revealed and the hungriest monster will eat the meal and add the total to its Power Level. If a monster eats too fast and exceeds level 20 it becomes too powerful and explodes. If it doesn’t eat the right stuff and goes below level 1, it becomes hangry and eats its human. The most powerful monster standing after 15 meals will be the winner!

boardgame.name: Pirate Raid
boardgame.description:
A simple skirmish game each players commands a small group of pirates raiding a Caribean village.
The villagers and any relief force are controlled by the rules.

Be the one to bring home the most loot and win the game.

Turn sequence:

At the start of each turn randomly decide the order that the players will activate in, which ever player is last draws a random event card and immediately plays it.
The players then take it in turns to move their figures fight combats and so on, after everyone has moved any defenders or relief force troops are moved.
From the start of turn 5 the player who is moving last instead on drawing a random event card rolls on the relief force table and places any troops as required.

boardgame.name: Wild West Gunfight
boardgame.description:
A simple game to recreate the gunfights common to most westerns and that even occasionally happened in real life.
Each player is assigned a force of about six figures and off you go.

Designed for 28mm figures but will work fine with what ever figures you have, could be played as a one against one game or, with an umpire, larger multi player games where everyone has a different objective.

Turn sequence:

Each player places their figure cards in a pile in front of themselves face down in the order they want to activate them in, the top card being the one they want to activate first.
Randomly decide who moves first then activate figures alternately until all figures have been activated.


—description from the publisher / rulebook

boardgame.name: Cat Go Nirvana: Awaken Question Battle Game
boardgame.description:
This game is racing to slow down. It's a good game for practicing to ask powerful question.

The game invites you to think, analyze, consider to slow down your points. Be with yourself for longer to win the game.

With game mechanics the player who slow, the more people want to question you. More good questions from friends who playing together.

Today we try to get the answers that are in front of each other quickly. But it doesn't mean the answer is yours. The answer that is most suitable for you or The answer that maximizes your potential.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mind Scanners
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Mind Scanners is an psychiatry simulation RPG set in a dystopian future. Players take on the role of a psychiatrist for for the state, called "The Structure." Through analyzing citizens' beliefs and behavior, the player must then diagnose and treat their conditions based on the strict balance of law and order The Structure demands. Time and resource management are paramount to success, and as a "Mind Scanner," players will use a variety of arcade style machines and game modes to "treat" their patients.

The game consists of a large cast of unique and interesting characters, and players will often be faced with difficult moral and ethical choices. Depending on a player's choices, the game and story will change. Choosing to aid an underground resistance group's cause or expose them to The Structure will present new benefits and costs that players must weigh as they progress. This emphasis on player choice gives Mind Scanners branching paths and tons of replay value.

boardgame.name: Warburg 1760
boardgame.description:
July 1760. The Coalition army commanded by Ferdinand of Brunswick falls back in the face of the French army, commanded by Broglie. To cut off the retreat of the Coalition, the Chevalier du Muy is sent north across the Diemel toward Warburg. Meanwhile, the German troops cross farther east at Liebenau. Du Muy deploys his army alongside the Diemel with its back to the river. Thanks to a turning movement masked by light troops of the British Legion and the mist of the morning, the troops commanded by the Hereditary Prince and Spörcken position themselves on the French left flank. At 13.00 this 31 July, the British and Hanoverian grenadiers appear at the rear of the French line, the Bourbonnais brigade counter-attacks, marking the beginning of a ferocious battle…
Warburg 1760 uses a simplified version of the rules of Corbach 1760 featured in VaeVictis #142.

One strength point =  150-200 men for the cavalry, 200-250 for the infantry
One hexagon = 250 m
One turn = 30 minutes
Difficulty = 5/10
Possibility for solo play = 6/10

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Countdown [1990]
boardgame.description:
Back of box
You've Been Framed!
Agent Frank McBain is dead... but why did they pin it on you? You've just 96 hours to find out... crack an international spy ring... and prevent a global disaster.

Your're American agent Mason Powers and you've just intercepted an ulter secret message about an internatonal terrorist group. Just as you're about to brief CIA Section Chief, Frank McBain, everything goes black... and you wake up in a remote prison hospital in Turkey... with no memory of what happened and changed with the murder of Frank McBain!

Who set you up? Who is trying to kill you? And why do you feel such intense urgency? The countdown has begun... and you better find the answer fast.

So Realistic, you'll think you're there!
COuntdown features breathaking Motion Craphics ... combining stunning 256-color movie-quality graphivs with RealSound, the revolutionary technology that gives you astonishing digitalized sound effects, music and speech without hardware.

boardgame.name: Cartabad
boardgame.description:
The little brother of cartaping :-)

Cartabad is a Badminton card game.

The goal is to win the match which is played in two winning sets of 11 points.

Player plays cards in his turn. There are 4 type of cards in this game:

Red cards impose a particular constraint to the opponent.
Green cards increase the possibilities of their owner.
Violet cards change the game for both players.
Orange cards change the other cards


Each card has a name, a particular effect, and acts for a specified period.

On each card are shown:

The effect of the card: "what"
To whom it is addressed: "who"
How long it will work: "when"

boardgame.name: A-Tech Cybernetic
boardgame.description:
A-Tech Cybernetic is a first-person shooter built from the ground up for VR. It features two separate game modes: a classic swarm mode to put your shooting and survival skills to the test and a story mode that takes you to a futuristic biomedical company overrun by mutants. Control everything with real-life movements, interact with your surroundings as if they were actually there, experience a new kind of gameplay that’s more immersive than ever before, thanks to VR.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Gold of the Aztecs
boardgame.description:
Back of box
Gold is the passion - death is the probability!

For 400 years no-one has dared to take up the toughest challenge man have ever known - to find QUetzacotl's Gold of the Aztecs. Bret Conrad's special forces training and combat duty have made danger a way of life. This times the odds are really stacked against him - and you, in one of the biggest, most facinating games ever devised!

[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).

[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.

In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.

boardgame.name: Ranx
boardgame.description:
Back of box
RANX Your mother wouldn't like it!

From Rome to New-York, psycho-plague is taking its victims. The President of United States, himself, is contaminated. You are Ranx, an android with muscles of steel, and only you can save the world. But, you are being tortured by something even worse. Your friend, Lubna, has disappeared and you want to find her at all costs. It's gonna hurt!

boardgame.name: Little Orpheus
boardgame.description: Little Orpheus is a technicolour side-scrolling adventure game inspired by classic movies like Flash Gordon, Sinbad and The Land that Time Forgot.

Family Board Game: OFF TRACK (print-and-play, learn about native Australian animals)

boardgame.description:

...

boardgame.name: The Fallen Crown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fallen Crown is a five level adventure taking place in the city-state Jeziblan, which takes the players from level 3 to level 8.

A military coup by a malicious and deranged Colonel against the popular legitimate leader, trouble in the streets as enforcers abuse their power to keep the populace in line, a mysterious plot that ravages the city, and a conspiracy to weaken and take down the illegetimate, oppressive dictator. The citystate of Jeziblan needs heros, lest it fall victim to the darkness being harnessed by those that seized its walls. Will the Party successfully save the town and set right the wrongs that led to its civil strife!

boardgame.name: Devil's Run Roleplaying Game Player's Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

WHEN THE GANGS TEAR UP THE FREEWAY…
CHOOSE A SIDE. FIGHT. SURVIVE.

TWO GREAT NATIONS THAT WERE DESTINED TO NEVER FIND PEACE DISAPPEARED
OVERNIGHT. ONE IS NOW AN IRRADIATED HOT-ZONE WHERE NOTHING SURVIVES. THE
OTHER A SPARESLY POPULATED WASTELAND THAT HAS PLUMMETED INTO ANARCHY
AND CHAOS. WATER, GAS, AND FOOD ARE THE ONLY CURRENCIES THAT MATTER ON A
CONTINENT RULED BY BULLETS, BALLS, AND BLOODSHED.

THE DEVIL’S RUN ROLEPLAYING GAME PUTS YOU IN THE DRIVING SEAT OF A POSTAPOCALYPTIC FUTURE IN WHICH GANG WARFARE DOMINATES. THE RULES OF THE ROAD ARE NONE. ALL YOU NEED ASK YOURSELF IS WHAT WOULD YOU KILL FOR?
WHAT WOULD YOU DIE FOR? HOW FAR ARE YOU WILLING TO FALL TO SURVIVE?

A brief history detailing the collapse of civilisation as we know it, stretching from before the launch that started it all, to the current state of the world twenty years later.
A detailed description of the former West Coast, including descriptions for several of the larger factions that battle to dominate its war-torn highways.
A complete guide to creating characters for the post-apocalypse of the Devil’s Run using the 2d20 ruleset.
An overview of the equipment available in the wasteland, plus handy tables for gear and weapon statistics .

boardgame.name: みっしょんずかっぷ！！ (Missions cup!!)
boardgame.description:
みっしょんずかっぷ！！ (Missions cup!!) is a set of party games from Japan, packaged in a take-away bubble cup. The package has a deck of cards with a variety of speedy tasks to do using the range of materials provided; strings, clay, chips, dice and so on.

Players turn up one of the cards and race to complete the task first and claim the card. The first to get five cards wins the game.

The tasks include things like tiddlywinks into to the cup, making up a picture (such as a face) using the bits, using the dice to make totals.

The publisher says:
Complete the mission instantly!
Make use of the wide variety of items!
An action party game in a cup!
Turn over the cards and carry out the missions depicted on them!
Turn over the cards and perform the mission! If you complete the mission, you get a card!
Get 5 cards and you win!
There are standard items like dice and chips, as well as more unusual items like clay and string!

ミッションを瞬間クリア！
種類豊富なアイテムを駆使しよう！
カップに入ったアクションパーティーゲーム！
カードをめくって、描かれたミッションを実施！
達成したらカードをゲット！
5枚ゲットしたら勝利！
ダイスやチップなど定番のものから、粘土・ひものような珍しいものまであります！
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Nothing Is Sacred
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Moonshaes are plunged into shadow and with permission of High Lady Ordalf, survivors have made their way to Gwynneth, the only Isle spared from darkness. The Conclave needs heroes to execute their plans of survival in the face of the most powerful threat the Moonshaes have yet seen, the Slain.

A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Tempest of Malice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The key to severing the chains of the Slain is located at Tempest Keep, and the adventurers must face the impossible — brave the wrath of the elements to harness the power of the storm.

A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: A Gift from the Queen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With the fate of the Moonshaes held in the balance, the adventurer’s path lies in the lost tomb of an ancient Queen. What answers could she possibly offer to loosen the Slain’s deadly hold on this world. A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 characters. Optimized for APL 13.

Contend Warning: This adventure contains themes of body horror. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: The Red Burnoose: Algeria 1857
boardgame.description:
Join Fadhma N'Soumer in her fight against the invading French armies in the Kabylie region of Algeria in 1857. You will join forces with up to 3 other players in the co-operative board game The Red Burnoose: Algeria 1857 to use deck-building and area-control elements to survive as the French advance on your villages.

The French are run as an automa deck for 1 to 4 players to defeat. Victory is achieved by outlasting the automa. Players control pieces on the board that they can strategically move between villages to help stop the French advance. Players use the cards in their hand and those they buy from the shared market to acquire new pieces for the board and to manipulate the board state.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Railroad Ink Challenge
boardgame.description:
Railroad Ink Challenge is the official adaptation of the critically acclaimed roll and write game created by award-winning designers Hjalmar Hach & Lorenzo Silva and illustrated by artist Marta Tranquilli.

In Railroad Ink Challenge, you have 7 rounds to make as many points as possible. Roll the dice and draw the routes to connect the exits around your board. Expand your network with railways, highways and stations to collect points, but you will be penalized for any open connections, so plan carefully! Play solo to improve your best score, or challenge players from all over the world!

HOW TO PLAY
Each round you will have to roll the dice and use the available routes to build your transportation network and connect as many exits as possible. Expand your network to collect points; you’ll also score bonus points for your longest highway and railway, for building into the central spaces of your map, and for completing optional, time-dependent goals before they expire.

You can also connect special structures to your network to trigger their special effects such as duplicating routes, unlocking powerful special routes, and more. But beware, try to not leave any open connections, as each one will cost you points at the end of the game.

EXPANSIONS
Forest, Desert and more expansions based on the physical board game are planned and will be coming soon as DLC in the months following release! These expansions add special dice and rules to create even more intricate landscapes for your highways and railways.

MODES
Play solo with random objectives and join the online rankings, or challenge players from all over the world with custom game configurations! The online leaderboards (Daily, Monthly, and All-Time) are completely cross-platform!

- The wonderful art of the roll and write game by Marta Tranquilli, fleshed out and digitally enhanced
- Network planning gameplay, try to make the best use of the available routes each round to create the perfect transportation network
- Try to conquer the top of the online leaderboards (Daily, Monthly, and All-Time)!
- Cross-platform, asynchronous multiplayer challenges with your friends!
boardgame.videogamebg: Railroad Ink Challenge: Lush Green Edition
Railroad Ink Challenge: Shining Yellow Edition

boardgame.name: The Living Temple and Other Tales
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

The Living Temple and Other Tales is a short 5e adventure that can be played in one session. When a farmer takes what he thinks to be a meteorite to the local temple, it hatches and reveals an evil from beyond the stars. The party must stop the creature before it outgrows the temple and escapes. A 5e adventure for 4-6 characters of 5th level.

The Living Temple Includes:

- 3 new 5e monsters
- A stunning map by Seth Tomlinson (Blades & Blasters)
- The Hunger Below - a short one-shot 5e adventure
- The Long Soak - a short 5e whodunit

boardgame.name: Godbound
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

More than a thousand years ago, the Former Empires ruled in glory. Wonders beyond imagining littered the nations of that ancient age, even the least of men and women living with the luxury of a Bright Republic oligarch. Hunger, sickness, ignorance, pain... all the blights to which mortal bodies are heir were banished by the marvels of the Former Empires. The agent of this mercy was the might of theurgy, the terrible High Magic uncovered by restless scholars of the old realms. With the secrets of theurgy at their disposal, sages were able to lay impious hands on the very levers of creation, manipulating cosmic powers far beyond the birthright of mortal humanity. The deep powers of the Creator were at their disposal at last, ready to glorify their kindred and exalt their causes.

boardgame.name: Fate/Apocrypha
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Nasuverse, in particular a timeline where during the 3rd Grail War the Einzbern Family decided not to try summoning a God of Evil and instead settled for gaming the system to get a Ruler Servant, one capable of using Command Seals on other Servants. Showing that this timeline isn’t too different from the others, they still managed to lose with this enormous advantage. On the plus side, the Greater Grail didn’t get corrupted. On the negative side….it got stolen by Nazis. Then stolen from them and has been hidden by a coalition of minor Magus families for several decades, while subspecies Holy Grail Wars were fought across the world – predictably, none of those ended well, with the possible exception of a certain Waver Velvet gaining the title of Lord El-Melloi, though now he has to deal with Flat. Now, finally, a genuine 4th Grail War dawns, but this isn’t the one you might recall from the tale of Fate/Zero.

boardgame.name: Grim Hollow - The Players Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Classic tabletop roleplaying games often see the adventurers striding boldly across the countryside, tracking evil to its lair and vanquishing it in the name of wealth and glory, protecting the world and its people for another day.

Dark fantasy tells a different story, and the world of Grim Hollow invites participants to imagine narratives tinged with shadow, fear, and the drama of despair.

In the world of Etharis, the roles are reversed from a typical high-fantasy campaign. It is the good who cower in their fragile bastions of civilization while evil stalks freely across the land. Adventurers skulk furtively through the shadows, always aware of the danger that follows closely behind them—or the danger lurking within their bodies and souls. Welcome to Grim Hollow!

boardgame.name: Fishing in Anthusis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Silverscales Tournament calls citizens and adventurers alike to participate in a competition to catch silver trout. This year, a pair of rival twins and some unexpected dangers ensure the event is one that the people of Anthusis will not soon forget.

boardgame.name: The Tireless Path
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A caravan is set to depart from the small town of Grayce, but it needs some capable guards. It's up to the PCs to step in and ensure the caravan, and its passengers, reach their destination.

boardgame.name: Troy: Green Expansion
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter exclusive of green cards. These add extra unknowns into the game of earthquake, poison, mourning and disease.
All affect both players and change the game. Some will even finish the game when played. All done when double 6 is rolled by a player.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Freedom for Wishes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Panic spreads throughout the Qadiran city of Sedeq when a party hosted by the infamous genie-binder, Corvius Vayn, goes horribly wrong. With wishes dispensed like confectionary to the guests, Vayn’s manor is now something out of a child’s wildest imagination and Sedeq’s town guard are paralyzed to act. With few good options, the Qadiran government requests the Pathfinder Society’s assistance in assessing what has happened in Vayn’s manor and put an end to the errant wishcrafting.

boardgame.name: A Dirge for Sarkoris
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Pathfinder Society is looking to reinforce its bonds of friendship with the Farheaven Clan of Sarkoris. A group of Pathfinders visits with the leaders of the clan and learn that they can be of assistance by travelling to the now demon-infested city of Storasta, lost to the Sarkorians generations ago. There, the Pathfinders must reclaim the remains of several honored dead interred within the boundaries of the settlement, all while trying to avoid the attention of the fiendish forces that still dwell within the city.

boardgame.name: Lost Maid of Anactoria
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When the grim “local celebrity” of the small village of Anactoria goes missing, its townsfolk reach out to the Pathfinder Society for assistance. A group of heroes arrive just as a band from the rival Aspis Consortium have headed out into the nearby swamps. Is this a coincidence, or is there more going on in Anactoria than meets the eye? Of course, everything is subjective when you visit a town where its celebrity is a mummified bog corpse!

boardgame.name: The Fanciful March of Urwal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With one of its masked leaders missing, the Pathfinder Society continues a desperate search of the forests in northern Iobaria. Urwal, leader of the Verdant Wheel faction, approaches a group of Pathfinders to assist him in travelling through the forest at the behest of some unknown force that beckons to him through dreams and visions. The end of this fanciful march could reveal where the Society’s leader has gone, but it could also lead the Pathfinder Society to uncovering more of the mysteries of distant Iobaria.

boardgame.name: Schuss auf's Tor!
boardgame.description:
The players roll three dice and split up the result to move one or more figures and the ball. The figures may move in any direction. The ball only moves straight away from a figure placed immediately behind the ball. Most soccer rules are simulated in the game.

The player who gets the most goals in a fixed time span (for example 2 x 30 minutes) wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Monstropoly Battle Card Game
boardgame.description:
In this game set in the universe of the stage personas of the Finnish Metal Band Lordi, every card is a monster. You, as a player, are trying to make a team of monsters that can help you most effectively slaughter your opponent's monsters.

The first phase of the game is played by playing single monsters from the players' hands and comparing "Force." The highest force wins. The winner of that match up (Or "round") draws a card from the top of the deck and decides to keep either it and one of the played cards, or both played cards, yielding the one remaining card to the loser.

When the entire deck is depleted and both players have their teams, they check to see point totals. A whole "Team" Based on its lead characters is worth Ten points, incomplete teams are only worth one point per character(For a maximum of four) if you have no complete teams, you lose automatically. The hands are broken up into their teams and incomplete ones are compiled into another deck.

The player with the least points starts the team battles by playing one card from one team and may only use this team until it is gone, same with the enemy player. A third card is drawn from the deck to determine weapon values of both cards. The highest total force still wins. The game ends when all teams have been returned to the deck and the player with the most points wins the battle.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Marvel United: X-Men – Brotherhood of Evil Mutants
boardgame.description: A Kickstarter Exclusive trio of evil mutants that act together as a team. The three characters are Pyro, Blob, and Toad. Their miniatures and the cards required to use them are included.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Marvel United: X-Men – Kickstarter Promos Box

boardgame.name: Murder Bunnies: The Killer Card Game
boardgame.description: Murder Bunnies is a 2-player strategy game where every ability has a trigger, and every turn could be your last. Capture, Spawn, Move, or Attack enemy bunnies on the field using your action points to maximize your murder and earn your share of the Carrot Bounty. But be careful - every bunny has an ability with a trigger built in, so plan your moves wisely.

boardgame.name: Two Stand To Fall
boardgame.description:
You and your partner stand against a terrible Crisis.

It shouldn’t have been anything new; the two of you had surpassed many hardships before, and forged a bond stronger than steel together. Together, you were supposed to be powerful.

But this time, things went horribly wrong. Even with your strengths combined, your last battle was certain to end in your defeat.

And so, your partner made the ultimate sacrifice: they sent you back to safety, while they stayed to fight the Crisis alone.

Two Stand To Fall is a solo storytelling game about people who would sacrifice for each other, in the face of a world that seeks their destruction.

Perhaps they live, in spite of the world. Perhaps they die, and are forever separated.

But there is a chance you both will come out alive. Therefore, you must try.

boardgame.name: Board Game of Kaaba
boardgame.description:
As technology advances, interpersonal communication is weakening by the day.
Children are drowning in a digitalized world while their parents have their hands full with their smartphones.
Therefore, we decided to develop an educational board game to teach children and adults about the Islamic faith through fun and games and to strengthen their relationship and communication with each other.
Especially in this day and age, where there is only ignorance or half-knowledge about Islam, we want to bring light into the darkness with this game.
With this game we also want to address non-Muslims in particular, so that they can gain an insight into Islam.

Gameplay:
The game’s design is that the Kaaba has to be circumnavigated seven times. Circling with the pawn is accomplished by answering questions on Islamic topics. The questions are divided into five difficulty levels. The more difficult the question, the more steps you can take if you answer it correctly. If a player, for example, correctly answers a question from category two, he or she can take two steps forward with the pawn.

Winning:
The goal of the game is to be the first to circle the Kaaba seven times with the pawn. The pawns are moved counterclockwise around the Kaaba just as is the case with the real Kaaba in Mecca. A circle (orbit) occurs every time the player has passed the starting position.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Macabre Mansion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your passage to Cathoway has gone slower than you hoped and a looming thunderstorm concerns you greatly. The Iron Hills give an eerie sense of doom as streaks of lightning begin to brew. Fortunately, a strange mansion sits on a hill in the vale and may perhaps offer safe harbor to you!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for six, initial level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Toy Troopers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Toy Soldiers can be Real Heroes!

The Grey Nation is on the march again, moving out of the Sister's bedroom and annexing more and more territory in the Corridor and the wild frontier of the Garden. Only the Green Toy Troopers can rally their vehicles and allied auxiliary soldiers to stem the rising tide of Grey Plastic! But it won't be child's play.

Toy Troopers is a cartoonish pulp war adventure starring animated toys. It combines the atmosphere of fantastic war stories with the absurd antics of living toys. The player characters are the little green army men and women who serve in the Green Army, or allied auxiliaries - other toy heroes.

This 100-page setting book that includes suggestions and rules on how to play a military adventure on your tabletop... in more ways than one.

Inside, you'll find:

Character creation guidelines for living toys: toy troopers, little bricko guys, and the Mindy fashion dolls.
Two dozen new advantages and disadvantages, for the toys (Toy of a Thousand Faces! Bendy! Big Dumb Head!) and soldiers (Improved Suppressive Fire, Famed Commander)
New Setting Rules: From air support to life as a fragile plastic figure.
Toy Gear - wield either plastic weapons or sharpened metal pieces scavenged in the wild.
A description of a House that seems like an entire universe for living toys... and other places like Park, School, or Shopping Mall.
A short Plot Point Campaign and a Mission Generator for the toy soldiers!
Dozens of enemies - from Greys to bugs to superhero action figures and the scary big baby doll!

boardgame.name: Toy Troopers Tale: Rise of the Toy Mafia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first in a series of one-shot adventures for Toy Troopers – a "living toy soldiers" setting from Gramel. In Toy Trooper Tales you'll find brief encounters, new enemies, or dangerous situations for your Green soldiers.

Toy Troopers plays out toy war stories for comedic effect: Rise of the Toy Mafia introduces a brand new threat to the toy world. The Green soldiers have to answer whether they should deal with organized crime, what are their duties... or they can just enjoy a chase after a ruthless clay-made gangster.

boardgame.name: Zoo Roll Out
boardgame.description:
The concept is simple: Help the animals break out of the zoo. Zoo Break is compact and easy to grasp for kids as young as five, who are still learning their numbers, but it involves strategy and level variations that make it intriguing for the sharpest of gamers. (We challenge advanced gamers to try getting through Levels 1-10 in one play session!) Zoo Break can be played alone, or collaboratively by multiple people. It's a great family game.

To play, simply shuffle the cards and lay them out in an 8x8 grid. Place the four colorful wooden animals in the center. Roll the green dice to guide the animals to freedom, using strategy to choose the best path for each animal. But watch out for the zookeeper! For every roll of the animal dice, you'll also roll the zookeeper dice. The zookeeper locks down cards and closes off escape routes with every roll.

Win the game by breaking out all four animals before their escape routes close. Strategy abounds around which paths to take, and this makes for great interaction with kid co-players. Four free spaces help you on your way. But if the zookeeper locks down a card that is currently occupied by an animal, it's back to the central cage!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Capturing Caesar's Camp: A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
boardgame.description:
Capturing Caesar’s Camp is a Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End and the Blitzkrieg 1940 Handbook.
A thirty-two page PDF, Capturing Caesar’s Camp contains an overview of the events of May and early June 1940. as the German panzers dashed across Northern France and the Low Countries, trapping the Allies at Dunkirk and forcing their evacuation. However, not all of the British forces withdrew across the Channel. To the South of the Somme, the 51st Highland Division remained to fight alongside their French comrades in the hope that a new defensive line could be formed and a second Britsh Expeditionary Force sent to continue the war.
This campaign focusses on the actions on the Somme, with the British, supported by French guns and armour, attempting to crush a bridgehead held by the German 57th Infantry Division. If the Highlanders can push the Germans back across the Somme, the much anticipated Weygand Line may become a reality and the German advance South checked.
The campaign is a total of Six game tables with the duration running between five and nine games.
Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Pint Sized Campaigns for Chain of Command
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Chain of Command: At the Sharp End – The Campaign Rules Supplement
Chain of Command: Blitzkrieg 1940 – A Handbook for Wargaming the Fall of France and the Low Countries

boardgame.name: Weed-opoly
Weedopoly
boardgame.description:
Weed-oploy is the board game where you tractor through the marijuana farm and try to reach End At Stoned first. Succeed and you become the head weedopolist.

Players role a 6 sided die to move around the board. Spaces have isntructions for players to follow. Other players will try to slow you down with "Take-a-Hit" cards. But the "Bad Brownie" cards will give you the opportunity to drive ahead. The "Take a Hit" cards will ask you to "Name at least 5 slang words for Marijuana" or successfully perform tongue twisters. "Bad Brownie" cards come in three categories: SOLO, DUET and ALL PLAY. Some of the challenges include: DUET: "You are staying up late, name places that are open 24 hours a day, compete with another player to name the most". SOLO: "Exercise isn't your thing, name 8 things that inflate". ALL PLAY: "You have the munchies, name types of pies, last player to name one moves up 3 spaces."

To win you will need a few baggies of luck and the ability to answer category questions mistakes. The winner is declared the Head Weedopolist and is entitled to all the rights and privileges it implies.

boardgame.name: Sad Days of Battle: The Battle of Jarama, February 6-27, 1937
boardgame.description:
“There's a valley in Spain called Jarama. it's a place that we all know so well. It was there that we fought against the fascists. We saw a peaceful valley turn to hell.”—Excerpt from Woody Guthrie’s song Battle of Jarama.

After failing to take Madrid in November, Francisco Franco ordered his forces to cut off the former capital city and now symbol of Republican resistance by taking the roads south of the city linking it to the Republican government in Valencia. The attack over the Jarama river was to be coordinated with the Italian’s offensive to the north and east of the city along the Guadalajara river. However, the Italians were taking longer than anticipated to get their forces into positions, hindered by poor weather and abysmal planning. With growing impatience General Franco ordered his forces to attack, supported by the German Condor Legion as well as masses of new German tanks, artillery pieces and ample supplies of ordinance.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Sad Days of Battle by the designer and publisher.
Mounted counters can be had a for an additional $8.00.
A custom card set for the game, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, is also available for an additional $10.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Weird Fantasy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Supernatural storms are common in the Western Wastes, and most of them have dangerous, often deadly, side effects. One of the more unusual types brings an unexpected boon to such a dread place: spawning storms. At random intervals—typically no more than twice annually but often not recurring for several years—spawning storms brew in the Wastes, dangerous thunderstorms that unleash torrents of rain from clouds flickering with multi-colored lightning. Flash floods sweep through the barren hills and across the dust-laden plains, everything awash in uncontrolled magic and imbued with a wild fecundity. This is known as the mad spring.

boardgame.name: Dungeons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I’ve grown tired of “killer dungeons in the old-school style.”

For starters, there is no definitive “old school of gaming.” I was excited to see that term gaining use a few years ago and embraced it, but that was more because of the sense of community it encompassed than because the term itself had objective meaning. In almost every case, “Old School” means “back when I started playing RPGs.” If you started in 1975 with the original three little brown books, then that’s old-school. If you started in 2001 with edition 3.5, then that’s old-school. If you started in 1985 with Vampire: The Masquerade, then that’s old-school. Everyone wants to own “old school,” so as a defining term, it’s pretty useless.

boardgame.name: The Glowing Ossuary, Part 2
Heart of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The lift lurches to a stop with makeshift broken archways opening to the west and south into an L-shaped chamber. The stone here looks much older and more neglected than in the chambers above. There are four ornate doors, two to the west and two to the south, each carved depicting a different dwarven figure. The chamber continues to the east and the north via stairs leading farther down.

boardgame.name: Moonlight Sonata
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The lift lurches to a stop with makeshift broken archways opening to the west and south into an L-shaped chamber. The stone here looks much older and more neglected than in the chambers above. There are four ornate doors, two to the west and two to the south, each carved depicting a different dwarven figure. The chamber continues to the east and the north via stairs leading farther down.
